title: How to Make a Felt Strip Flower

steps.headline: Cut the piece of felt into half lengthwise.
Cut slits at even intervals all the way along the length.
steps.description: Do not cut all the way up; cut about 4cm and leave a border in place.

steps.headline: Squeeze hot glue across the border part of the length.
steps.description: Once the glue is in place, roll the length up along the glue. When it has rolled up, let it dry.

steps.headline: Flop the strips to the sides.
Glue a button into the center of the flower.
steps.description: Press down firmly and let it dry.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The felt strip flower is now ready for use on a craft project or to be added to a hair accessory. Make as many as you need using the same method.

steps.headline: Cut two strips of felt from two different colors.
steps.description: Cut the strips 1.2cm (1/2 inch) in width. The length is up to you but be aware that the longer the strip is, the larger the flower size becomes. Choose colors that match well.

steps.headline: Place one strip on top of the other strip.
steps.description: Roll up the strips from one end, to create a firm spiral.

steps.headline: Glue the ends.
steps.description: Glue down the bottom strip, then glue the outside strip. Trim off any excess felt.

steps.headline: Gently push the middle out a little way.
steps.description: This gives the flower a more dimensional aspect.

steps.headline: Cut out small leaf shapes from green felt.
steps.description: Glue one or two to the base of the flower to complete it.

steps.headline: Complete.
steps.description: The flower is now done. Make as many as needed for your craft project.

steps.headline: Run a length of glue across one lengthwise edge of the felt piece.
Fold the felt in half, pressing the edge onto the glue.
steps.description: Allow to dry before proceeding. The fold allows for the cut pieces to form loops that won’t undo.

steps.headline: Using pinking shears, cut slits at even intervals all the way along the length.
steps.description: Do not cut all the way up; cut about 4cm and leave a border in place.

steps.headline: Squeeze hot glue across the border part of the length.
steps.description: Once the glue is in place, roll the length up along the glue. When it has rolled up, let it dry.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The looped felt strip flower is now ready for use on a craft project or to be added to a hair accessory. Make as many as you need using the same method.

text: Many strips felt flower Cut the piece of felt into half lengthwise.  Cut slits at even intervals all the way along the length. Do not cut all the way up; cut about 4cm and leave a border in place. Squeeze hot glue across the border part of the length. Once the glue is in place, roll the length up along the glue. When it has rolled up, let it dry. Flop the strips to the sides. This forms the flower. Glue a button into the center of the flower. Press down firmly and let it dry. Done. The felt strip flower is now ready for use on a craft project or to be added to a hair accessory. Make as many as you need using the same method. Rolled strip felt flower Cut two strips of felt from two different colors. Cut the strips 1.2cm (1/2 inch) in width. The length is up to you but be aware that the longer the strip is, the larger the flower size becomes. Choose colors that match well. Place one strip on top of the other strip. Roll up the strips from one end, to create a firm spiral. Glue the ends. Glue down the bottom strip, then glue the outside strip. Trim off any excess felt. Gently push the middle out a little way. This gives the flower a more dimensional aspect. Cut out small leaf shapes from green felt. Glue one or two to the base of the flower to complete it. Complete. The flower is now done. Make as many as needed for your craft project. Looped strip felt flower Run a length of glue across one lengthwise edge of the felt piece.  Fold the felt in half, pressing the edge onto the glue. Allow to dry before proceeding. The fold allows for the cut pieces to form loops that won’t undo. Using pinking shears, cut slits at even intervals all the way along the length. Do not cut all the way up; cut about 4cm and leave a border in place. Squeeze hot glue across the border part of the length. Once the glue is in place, roll the length up along the glue. When it has rolled up, let it dry. Done. The looped felt strip flower is now ready for use on a craft project or to be added to a hair accessory. Make as many as you need using the same method.
